intro: Adicea nutans, commonly known as the nodding adicea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that droop downward, giving it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Adicea nutans typically grows in woodland areas and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
